result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen R. Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.
  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  Abide by all mental health programs.  Deft must complete a psychological evaluation & follow through with recommendations.
  The Defendant is to abide by all rules and conditions of the Agent.
  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.
  The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Costs waived.
  The Defendant is not to go into any bars, taverns or businesses where the primary purpose is to sell alcohol.
No contact with Lisa Jones unless approved by Agent.

supervisions.notes:
**11-11-2016 - Per Court's order, an Amended Information filed correcting statute severity.  Court requesting an addendum to PSI and defendant will be re-sentenced as to Count 1.

**12-22-2016 - Court vacates sentence.
